verse.name: v1
verse.lines: Have ye heard the story from the land of Calontir? With sword and axe a-swinging fit to make a grown man fear? The barons called for taxes, the people answered "Nay!" "And if you come collecting, there'll be hell to pay!

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: Have you seen the army, it was here a while ago, And do you know who's winning? Have we struck a mortal blow? I do not know your armor, but you seem a friend to me, Oh have you seen the army marching in Forgotten Sea? HMMMMMMMMMMM

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: You should have seen the battle, 'twas a glory to be seen, Conveniently the dead were rolled into a deep ravine, The bandits followed Halidar into a brushy patch, If it hadn't been poison ivy they'd have won without a scratch!

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: 'Twas at the bridge they tell me, that they made their final stand, But it's hard to win a battle when you're killed by your own man. The captain of the guardsmen hit upon a plan so bold, With a trick used every tax-time, hide your sacks of gold!
